intro: Hieracium exacutiforme, commonly known as the sharp-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, featuring hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from June to August. Hieracium exacutiforme is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
